section.title: About validation rules, validation rule groups and validation notifications
section.para: A validation rule is based on an expression which defines a relationship between data element values. The expression forms a condition which should assert that certain logical criteria are met.

listitem.para: The operator defines whether the left side must be less than, equal to or greater than the right side.

example.para: A validation rule could assert that the total number of vaccines given to infants is less than or equal to the total number of infants.

section.para: A validation rule group allows you to group related validation rules. When you then run a validation rule analysis, you can select whether to run all validation rules in the system, or just the validation rules in one group.

You can configure a validation rule analysis to automatically send out to information about validation violations to selected user groups. These messages are called validation notifications and are send via the internal DHIS2 messaging system.
